ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: greater knowledge of russian language and culture
Furthered my understanding of the Russian language, and advanced my reading, writing, and speaking skills.

This class reinforces knowledge of basic Russian grammar learned in L1 and L2, and adds new vocab, verbs of motion, and other nuances of time expressions and prepositions. There is a lot of speaking practice in class as well as oral midterms and finals, which really help improve accent, pronunciation, and question comprehension.
I learned a lot of vocabulary for the Russian language and worked a lot on time expressions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I loved this course! It is definitely a lot of work, but it is worth it. I feel like I improved so much this semester, and really got to dive into the Russian language. I found that Irina was much more focused on helping us learn and grow than forcing us into assignments and exams before we were ready. I had so much fun in class every day, and will honestly really miss it. The only weakness I can think of is a lack of communication between the prof and the TF. Often, it was a bit unclear whether we had an assessment, or when that assessment was, due to this lack of communication. But other than that, I loved the class!
I found that the method of teaching in which it emphasized speaking a lot and reading and class really helped the learning experience.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend it. I thought the content was a natural step-up from L2, and loved the teaching team and the overall structure of the class.

Yes, even though I did not go into this class extremely passionate about Russian and mostly wanted to complete my language requirement it has been an extremely memorable part of my college experience and has taught me leaps and bounds above first-year Russian. I feel I have a much stronger grasp on the language and grammar.
yes if you enjoy russian language

Absolutely. Irina is an amazing teacher and was extremely kind and understanding throughout the entire class. I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in furthering their knowledge of Russian.

Absolutely! This class was my favorite Russian class I've taken at Yale! I felt so actively engaged in my own learning and that of my classmates, and was truly happy to come to class every morning. L3 is also a nice place in the Russian language learning process to really focus on honing your speaking skills and synthesizing written grammar with spoken grammar. It's an excellent course.
